quiz.text: Find the average speed of each bike, at which they are ridden.
options: 73.4 km/h
69.4 km/h
60.4 km/h
75.4 km/h
65.4 km/h

quiz.text: Find the difference between the distance covered by bike Q in 48 minutes at 60% of its maximum speed and that covered by bike T in 50 minutes at 55% of its maximum speed.
options: 10 km
7 km
15 km
8 km
5 km

quiz.text: When the person goes to his office by bike P at 40% of its maximum speed, he reaches office 5 minutes late and when he goes to his office by bike R at 62.5% of its maximum speed, he reaches office 5 minutes earlier. Find the distance of his office.
options: 20 km
30 km
25 km
10 km
15 km

quiz.text: Find the ratio of maximum speeds of bikes P and Q together to the maximum speeds of bikes R, S and T together.
options: 110: 153
55: 76
80: 113
75: 106
60: 83

quiz.text: Find the average of distances covered by all the 5 bikes in the time, given in the bar graph.
options: 52.2 km
58.2 km
48.2 km
50.2 km
46.2 km

quiz.text: Arun traveled ‘K’ km with speed of S km/h in 2.5 hours. Varun traveled twice the distance traveled by Arun in 3 hours 20 minutes, while Tarun traveled (2K – 40) km in 10 hours. Speed of Varun is 4M km/h more than Arun, while speed of Tarun, Arun and Varun are in increasing AP (Same order). Speed of Tarun is ______ km/h. I. 4M km/hII. S/2 km/hIII. 2S/3 km/h
options: I only
II only
III only
I and II only
None of these

quiz.text: A train travelling at 90 km/hr crosses another train, having 20 meter more length and traveling in the opposite direction at 72 km/hr in 12 seconds. If a smaller train crosses a railway bridge in 28 seconds then ________ seconds time will take for longer train to crosses the same bridge?
options: 42 seconds
36 seconds
48 seconds
25 seconds
None of these

quiz.text: A Person starts Driving by car from Chennai to Trichy at a speed of 60km/hr. After covering 50% of the distance, he realized that he won’t reach on the estimated time if he continues at same speed. He thus increased his speed by 16 2/3% and he reached the destination on the time. Had he not increased the speed, he would have got late by one hour. _______hrs time taken by him to travel from Chennai to Trichy if the speed of the car is 120kmph?
options: 7 hours
6 hours
5 hours
10 hours
None of these

quiz.text: A person riding a bike, travels a distance of 432 km with a speed of K km/hr. After travelling 12.5% of distance, due to some construction work on the road which is ahead till 66.66% of the remaining distance, its speed was reduced by 20%. The initial speed of bike is ________km/hr. After covering under construction road distance, there is a traffic jam so its speed was reduced by 16.66% of the previous speed, and completed the journey with this speed. If he covers the whole distance with an average speed that is 20% more than his initial speed then he takes 6.6 hours less than the previous case.
options: 36 km/h
24 km/h
50 km/h
30 km/h
None of these

quiz.text: Speeds of Boat X and Y are 45km/h and 75 km/h respectively. Both Boat X and Boat Y start at same time along the stream from point A and running towards B. If after 5 hours travel there is technical problem so speed of boat X in still water is reduced by 30%. The distance between boat X and Y is _______km, When Y reaches at point B. Speed of the stream is 5 km/h and the distance between A and B is 640 km?
options: 305.5 km
315.5 km
325.5 km
280.5 km
215.5 km

quiz.text: In each of the following question two or more statements is given. You are expected to decide which of the following statement or pair of statements is sufficient to answer the question.Prashant and Satish started from two cities Delhi and Chandigarh respectively, traveling at constant speeds, to reach Chandigarh and Delhi respectively. At what time will they meet?Statement I: The distance between Delhi and Chandigarh is 250 km. Prashant travels at 50 km/hr and Satish travels at 25 km/hrStatement II: Prashant started from Delhi at 5:00 a.m. and reached Chandigarh at 11:00 a.m. Satish started from Chandigarh at 7:00 a.m. and reached Delhi at 3.00 p.m.
options: Only statement I alone is sufficient
Only statement II alone is sufficient
Either Statement I or II is sufficient
Neither Statement I nor II is sufficient
Both Statements I & II are sufficient

quiz.text: In each of the following questions three or more statements are given. You are expected to decide which of the following statements or pair of statements is sufficient to answer the question.A boatman covers a total distance of ‘2D + 160’ km daily. He started from his home daily at a fixed time and went to his workplace and after that came home by the same route. Speed of the river is 4 km/h, and he used different boats on each day. The flow of the river is from home to the workplace.Statement I: Speed of boat in still water on Monday is 50% more than that of Wednesday, which is 55.55% less than that on Tuesday.Statement II: Total traveling time on Wednesday is 128/3 hours.Statement III: The time taken for the forward journey on Monday is 12.5% less than the return journey on Tuesday.
options: Only I and III together sufficient
Only II and III together sufficient
Only I and III together sufficient
By Combination any two statements
None of these

quiz.text: In the questions the question is followed by four statements provided in the options. Read all the statements carefully and find which of the following statements cannot answer the question.A, B and C were traveling between cities X and Y by bus, car, and train respectively. The speed of the bus is 40 kmph. What is the distance between city X and Y?
options: The ratio of the speed of bus to train is 1:2 and the difference between the time taken by them is 3 hours
If the bus runs 25% faster, it will take 20% less time to cover the distance
The average of speed of a bus and car is 50 km/hr. and the average time taken is 5 hrs.
If the car covered half of its journey at the speed of a bus and the remaining half at twice the speed of the bus, the time taken will be 4.5 hours
None of these.

quiz.text: Directions: Each of the questions below consists of a question and two statements numbered I and II given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question. Read both the statements and give answer:How much time will Nikhil take to cover a distance of 180 km at a uniform speed?Statement I: The usual speed of Mohit is 8 km per hour more than that of Nikhil.Statement II: If Mohit increases his speed by 25% then he takes 2 hours less to cover a distance of 320 km.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question while data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
If data either in statement I alone or statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
If data in both statements I & II together are necessary to answer the question
If data given in both I & II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: On a recent journey Amit drove from City P to city Q to city R. His average speed for the whole journey was 35 km/hr. Find the average speed on his journey from city Q to city R. Statement I:  Average speed during the journey from city P to city Q is 70 km/hr   Statement II: Total time taken for the entire journey is 7 hours   Statement III: Ratio of distance travelled while going from P to Q and Q to R is 4 : 3
options: Only I and II together sufficient
Only II and III together sufficient
Only I and III together sufficient
All the statements are required
None of these

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I, II and Quantity III on its basis. (only quantity is to be considered)Speeds of A, B, C and D are 10 km/hr, 15 km/hr, 20 km/hr and 25 km/hr respectively.Quantity I: A, B and D start running from the same point on a circular track of 5 km in the clockwise direction. What distance (in km) is covered by B till the time when A and D meet for the first time after starting the race.Quantity II: C and D live in the same house and work in the same office. They take a combined time of 30 minutes to reach their office from their home. What is the distance (in km) from the house to the office?Quantity III: C is 28,000 meters behind B. If C started chasing B, in how many hours will C catch B?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I < Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II = Quantity III

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I and Quantity II on its basis. (only quantity is to be considered)Quantity I: The speed of a stream is 16.67% of the speed of a boat in still water, which is 24km/h. In how much time the boat can cover a distance of 840km in the stream?Quantity II: 35 hours
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: II ≥ Quantity: I
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I and Quantity II on its basis. (only quantity is to be considered)Quantity I: A 720 meters long train can cross an 800 meters long platform in 160 seconds, what is the speed of the train?Quantity II: A bike goes 54 km and comes back to the starting point in 4 hours, what is the speed of the bike?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≤ Quantity: II
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Directions: In each of the following questions, read the given statement and compare the Quantity I and Quantity II on its basis. (only quantity is to be considered).A car covers the first 30 km in 25 minutes and the remaining 100 km in 75 minutes.Quantity I: What is the average speed of the car (in km/hour)?Quantity II: What is the speed (in km/hour) of the car in the first part of the journey?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≤ Quantity: II
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: Quantity I: Niharika reaches her school from her house in 15 hours. If she increases her speed by 40%, then how long will she take to cover the same distance? Quantity II: Niharika reaches her school from her house in 18 hours. If she increases her speed by 20%, then how long will she take to cover the same distance?
options: Quantity: I > Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≥ Quantity: II
Quantity: I < Quantity: II
Quantity: I ≤ Quantity: II
Quantity I = Quantity II or relation can't be established

quiz.text: A train crosses a tunnel in 30 seconds and length of tunnel is twice that of train. If speed of train were 5 m/s more and length of train were 20% more, it would take 26(2/3) seconds to cross the tunnel. If a man is walking inside the train at the speed of 5 m/s and cover the length of train in ‘t’ seconds, then find the distance covered by train in ‘t’ seconds?
options: 1050 m
1250 m
1000 m
1500 m
1650 m

quiz.text: P and Q both started at the same time, travelling from Point A to point C via point B. Speed of P is thrice of Q while traveling from A to B and  then from B to C their speeds are interchanged. Find the ratio of time taken by P and Q to travel from A to C, if the distance between B and C is 40% more than that of A to B.
options: 11:13
9:11
13:11
11:7
None of these

quiz.text: Speed of P is 60% of Q. Both started at the same point M simultaneously and ran towards N. After covering 20% of total distance, speed of P and Q interchanged, find the ratio of time taken by Q to cover the total distance to the time taken by P to cover the total distance.
options: 5:4
17:23
9:5
23:17
None of these

quiz.text: A man walking from his home at a 5 km/hr speed reaches his friend’s house 10 minutes late. After that, he returned to his home at a speed of 7km/hr and reached 4 minutes earlier. Then find the distance traveled by a man.
options: 245 km
490 km
500 km
480 km
None of these

quiz.text: The sum of the speed of the boat in still water and the speed of the current is 30 kmph. The boat covers 360 km against stream in z hours and the same boat covers 600 km along with stream in z hours. What is the distance covered by the boat in still water in 5 hours?
options: 120 km
150 km
180 km
210 km
240 km
